meanings.definition: To grow old or show signs of aging.
meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden are senescing, turning brown and wilting.
meanings.sent2: My grandparents are senescing gracefully, embracing their old age with wisdom.
meanings.sent3: The old clock on the wall seems to be senescing faster than the rest of the room.
meanings.sent4: As the seasons change, the leaves senesce, reminding us of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house appeared senescing, with peeling paint and sagging roof.

meanings.definition: The process of aging or deterioration.
meanings.sent1: The senescing of the building was evident in the cracks on the walls and roof.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the senescing of cells to understand the effects of aging on the body.
meanings.sent3: The senescing of the car made it look like a vintage relic on the road.
meanings.sent4: The senescing of the bridge was a reminder of the passage of time and wear and tear.
meanings.sent5: The senescing of the tree was a beautiful sight, with its gnarled branches and weathered bark.
